p: The reported data related to TPC and TFC of the shell portion of walnut fruit summarized in Table 2 are also expressed as mg/g. As illustrated in Table 3, it can be observed that the TPC for the shell was 18.4 and 68.34–200 mg/g in the DW and the prepared extract, respectively. The content of total flavonoid values for the walnut shell was also changed to mg/g, and it was found that it contains 4.86 and 80.40–162.5 mg/g of DW and the extract, respectively. Both TPC and TFC have not been determined in the fresh walnut shell. These reported values indicated that the obtained extracts derived from walnut shell have a higher content of phenolic and flavonoid constituents.
